overview: Georgia O'Keeffe was an American abstract painter, famous for the purity and lucidity of her still-life compositions. O'Keeffe moved to New Mexico in 1949, and is best known for her large paintings of desert flowers and scenery, in which single blossoms or objects such as a cow's skull are presented in close-up views.  Titles in the series include:  D2167 Mary Cassatt  D2168 Frida Kahlo  D2169 Georgia O'Keeffe
title: Great Women Artists - Georgia O'Keeffe
